intro: Lotononis calycina var. acuta, commonly known as the sharp-leaved lotononis, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, narrow, and sharply pointed leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pale blue or violet in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely distributed outside its native range.
